event.title: was created by the provisional government of Oregon Territory on August 20, 1845

data.event: It was created by the provisional government of Oregon Territory on August 20, 1845, and at that time covered the entire present-day state.

event.title: began as the District of Vancouver on July 27, 1844

data.event: Clark County began as the District of Vancouver on July 27, 1844.
In 1845 the provisional government changed its name to Vancouver County.

event.title: June 15, 1846 the United States Senate approved

data.event: On June 15, 1846 the United States Senate approved the present boundary between the U.S. and Canada at the 49th Parallel.
